narrative.title: 1St South African Division - 1941Q2
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1941Q2.
narrative.objectives: Standard Commonwealth infantry division conducting mountain warfare in East African campaign. Mission in Q2 1941: pursuit of Italian forces north from Addis Ababa toward Amba Alagi. Division executed rapid advance covering 2,735km in 53 days (January-April 1941).
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Ethiopian highlands - mountainous terrain, altitudes 2000-3000m, some arid lowlands. Significantly different from North African desert.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mountain warfare experience from Ethiopian highlands campaign
Rapid motorized movement across difficult terrain
Combined arms cooperation with East African forces

environment.terrain_type: Ethiopian highlands - mountainous terrain, altitudes 2000-3000m, some arid lowlands. Significantly different from North African desert.
